8WH9YMf1wKOuuAx9kGfkVw.text: First time in today ... ordered a California roll , edamame (with I believe it's called Thai ginger sauce ) , steak tacos and blackened fish tacos . Overall I give the restaurant a 3.5/5. The California roll was great , I really enjoyed the edamame sauce but edamame was still a little raw , steak tacos were GREAT , fish taco had BARELY ANY FISH.  Everything had a little spice and the rice they serve with the tacos tasted like it had a pound of butter on it. Place was clean and nice and service was good .

pwiq2Dc2fXM_2UY7Tl9f5g.text: Excellent sushi, above par service, and great happy hour specials. Will be back soon to try other menu selections. Give this place a try!

2QVEeGpRRChUFp5K76m-BA.text: Good food good atmosphere and great service. I only wish they had more food on the HH menu.

A39r0QFLDHa80gzbjQyfcA.text: The fish and chips is out of this world! Everything we ordered was incredible. High quality and well worth the price

fH_TGkN8tLaI9usmWDFhdw.text: Great food. Very diverse menu for all kinds of pallets. Would definitely go back! Sushi, halibut & crab served at our table.  All were excellent.

2gurM_s5w5EB8MO1hC1aKg.text: So this review is long over due. The family an I where on this side of town (Ahwatukee or Phoenix depending who you talk too.. lol) and we where in the mood for sushi and burgers, yeah I know strange combo but Smokin Fins had what we where looking for. When you walk-in through the massive wood doors your greeted by the host/ hostess and seated. Yes I know that is nothing special but it's done with a smile and that should be noted. Okay now the menu !! But let me back track a bit since going here we have ordered all of the appetizers!! Our hands down favorite is the bacon and Brussels sprouts !!! Okay back to the menu, we have loved everything, and have yet to be disappointed in any way. In fact, recently this is our  go to place on Sundays because you can't beat the specials. Plus the manager there always seats us in our favorite spot by the wine bottle wall. Oh did I forget to mention the AMAZING WINE AND SPIRITS!  Yup all bold caps because that's what you do when you really want to express how much you like something. WE REALLY ENJOY SMOKIN FINS THE FOOD AND DRINKS ARE AMAZING AND THE STAFF ARE ON POINT.

yB3rhWbbLw2oUuB14Hh0RA.text: Had the lobster tater-tots, they were pretty good but nothing amazing; nice way to start. The cedar plank salmon was, however, exceptional. It was very well done, came out on a plank of cedar with embers still glowing. It was hot, flavorful, moist, just really well done. Service was nice, ambiance was nice. If I'm near by, I'll go again !

o3XZBY46np-xzIr3GRP65g.text: So happy we came across this place. Our server David provided top of the line service. The ambience is hip and the patio was nice even in the heat of the summer. Most importantly the food was the best I've had in the Phoenix area in quite some time.  We tried the stuffed crab avocado, Calamari, and the smoked prime rib sandwich and they were all to die for. I can't wait to come back and try more menu items.

4LloBW9TGv9WrlTNrjtH-Q.text: Between 2-stars "Meh, I've experienced better" and 3-stars "A-OK", I gotta go with the lower rating.  It was our first time.  Arrived a little after 6pm on a Friday, the place looked great -- not crowded anywhere -- and the staff were very friendly and efficient, not too pushy.    But the food.  First visit, standard dish calibration: Calamari were in soft breading and and cooked to barely brown.  Didn't overcook the meat but there was little flavor and no texture, no chew of any sort.  What sort of place is this?  Prime rib and wedge salads, plus sushi and famous for seafood?  Over-the-top corporate menu.  My wedge salad was big with lots of garnish but only kind of resembled one; definitely not a knife-cut wedge of iceberg.  In comparison, the Caesar was tiny, with  shaved Parmesan but without any apparent Romaine.  My wife's plank-grilled salmon was reported as quite good, but my sliced roast beef sandwich on baguette was sub-par: all the meat was piled in the middle, where it was cut, to look abundant; half the baguette was empty.  A soup-bowl of jus for dipping wasn't much help though the small ramekin of horseradish was potent.  Regular shoestring fries were quite good but "spicy barbecue" seasoning on the side didn't impress.   When we left at nearly 7:30, only 5 tables of 20 were occupied inside, plus a few seats at the bar and on the patio.  Prime time for dinner and nobody there?   Maybe that's the message.

fYOIliWXhNSn8wNrwSQ5cQ.text: Calamari is awesome. Sushi is worse than the grocery market. Waitresses nice and pleasant to look at. Restaurant is designed well too.

YR9txp-cBksIyHBIwmUtJQ.text: The oysters were awesome but the sushi was really dry and not worth the money! If you want something worth the money, shrimp tacos all the way and the shrimp appetizer. It's a cool atmosphere! I have had better service though. Good for a big group get together.

mekOpLVGZQf86xIlc8N7YA.text: Don't believe the hype. Nothing about this place is good other than the sake. My soup was tasty but no where near hot. Nigiri sake wasn't even fresh enough to bite into. I'll pass.

V-hNM9mbHqfzABh4f6j3vw.text: Best Banana pudding I've ever had!!! Great service... clean new place. Highly recommend

UVOgDz1enBvIt_n7agHWSQ.text: Great unique food and tastes! The sushi is authentic and filling the lobster tater tots are the best! I hope this place stays around for a while because they are great!

uOw3WKKk5mHJWtQH9XvxeA.text: I am coming back. I was very impressed with the menu and everything we ordered was outstanding. Spicy Lobster Roll, Philly Roll, Shrimp Scampi and Lobster filled Avocado. This is a new favorite Sushi place. Ambiance is chill, with a sharp, clean, contemporary look. Patio was awesome as the weather allowed us to relax outside.

MQbyqXH01V2VCAnbBG1LjA.text: So you say you're a foodie? And you have'nt been here?!?! My only complaint was I born with only one stomach. Too much good stuff to choose from. Sushi, eclectic seafood creations, fresh as f!#*! Its all there... on point drinks to wash all the goodness down. Ask the bartender for some Jimmy Juice in your Greyhound.... with a cherry on top

xUfR8kfC3Qk_u5ffuNuNvg.text: The food was very good and so was the service. My 3 kids even enjoyed the char grilled oysters and Kobe beef tacos.

Exvw6WbDweiJKbeE-m69mQ.text: We stumbled upon this restaurant while going to Longhorn Steakhouse next door, and wanted to give it a try. We were told it's only been open about three months. We tried the Calamari appetizer, the Kahlua Pig entree and the California and Rock Lobster rolls. The portions were more than enough. More than the size, the rolls were fresh and very tasty, but the Lobster was a little too spicy for my wife. The pulled pork dish was exceptionally tasty. The service was excellent, but the place was noisy (no noise abatement). The lighting was lovely at first glance, but at our table it was dark. The food was so good, the prices were within reason, so we'll definitely return.

JorVFdb4hzjybKDn0p38cg.text: This place is amazing.  We came in on a whim for Friday night date night.  We ordered the stuffed mushrooms and kicking shrimp appetizers, along with the oysters.  All three were amazing.  After apps we split the Chipotle salmon, which was amazing.  No desserts though, because we were stuffed by then.  Service was attentive, atmosphere was a little loud, but not too bad for a busy Friday night.  Overall a great experience!

VSTeAqKZZFKHtZekc1qN3Q.text: Really enjoyed a family meal here this evening. Staff was very friendly, food was tasty and it was a fun environment.

HU_4TVh5TmehKNCmo3p8fg.text: Everything was so amazing here! From the delicious lobster tots to the yummy bread pudding for dessert! Highly recommend

Lo8MVTE0ovLJeT4nRGByPA.text: This was my husbands favorite restaurant but we were very disappointed today. I took my husband here for his birthday celebration and arrived at 8:43 pm. After waiting about 10 minutes at the front hostess stand we walked in and asked one of the waitresses if we could seat ourselves or need to wait and at that time we were told the kitchen was already closed! We had checked online earlier today and called and had confirmed the closing time of 10pm.

nEI_xdPEJtKu3wM0TEPrmw.text: We were super excited to try this place out because it seemed like it had good reviews, good seafood, and it is super close to us! Everyone was super friendly, the service was great and the place in general was super cool and hip! But once we got our food we were disappointed. We got oysters which were pretty good. We also got chowder and a Caesar salad. The chowder didn't really taste like chowder and the oyster crackers and saltine crackers were so stale! And then I realized the croutons on my Caesar salad were also stale. So overall was pretty disappointed and might be back but only for the oysters!

c0QRYhLxjh-6Jxe_Fce3Jw.text: Incredible atmosphere, friendly/professional associates, and wonderful entrees!  The chef (Carlos) is willing to be adventuresome and provide flexibility to the menu.  Nate and Sarah (Managers) are accommodating and make you feel like part of the family!  One of the BEST restaurants and eating experiences I've had in the Chandler/Ahwatukee area!  I highly recommend this wonderful restaurant...GREAT DINING EXPERIENCE!  Marshall Richards

BoFBMdATLRAvwL2AwO_dsQ.text: My son and I went here to try their Sushi.  Note:  they have some, but this is not a sushi place.  We kept it simple - sake salmon nigiri and California rolls for the sushi.  It was of passable quality, but nothing I'd go out of my way for.  They advertised a unique calamari dish, so I tried it.  It too was all right, but nothing special.  Finally, I tried the roasted cauliflower and Brussels sprouts appetizer:  this was way too salty - I had to send it back.  They remade it for me with about a quarter of the salt, but I still walked away feeling like I'd eaten a salt lick.  I felt pretty terrible after leaving the restaurant.  The waitstaff was well-intentioned, but inexperienced.  There were lots of apologies for delayed service, reading from notes, wrong meals served, etc.    Maybe I missed the meals that would make this place more popular, but I give this place a solid "meh."  I won't likely be back

_gvBW9IE0G6Xa73oUmFTiA.text: A great spot to try! The food no matter what you order is good. We had a sushi roll it was a popular,but can't remember the name. The bison was amazing with veggies and mash potatoes! This is a newer place and is always busy. The servers are very friendly and attentive.

2_1LVIsHlmrO4BBr5j2k0Q.text: Not sure how they got four stars from others. Nice atmosphere but The menu is too diverse and lacks focus. Sushi snd salad were mediocre. Clam chowder was good. Server didn't know they had a weekend prime rib special. The prime rib came out medium well and I had to send it back. Same for my friend's rib eye which had a very odd tasting rub. When prime rib came back it was practically raw and yet very chewy. Manager came out and apologized but we will not return.

uVljpBc2WQJD8WVzao0B5g.text: Atmosphere is great, service was great, food was good- not great. Everything we ordered (kickin shrimp, spicy tuna roll, and el diablo roll)  tasted good but it's all drenched in sauces. I would order the spicy tuna without the aioli next time!   For drinks we both ordered the happy hour mule and it was good but inconsistent- mine was heavy on the vodka and my fiance's was heavy on the ginger beer.

kZ8TuN1p5IpkeE3cFSLC1Q.text: Had a really nice night out at smokin fins. Sat at the bar and tried the jalapeno and cilantro margarita. It was so good. Our food, pulled pork bbq sandwich with cajun fries, and tater tot  lobster rolls were to die for. Our bartender was excellent and was  very cool and attentive. Her name was Lindsey and she was awesome. Great place for fun creative drinks and really good food plus a nice atmosphere.

P0FDXJ8V_m_viQYsQIwKlw.text: We had higher expectations for this place. We so wanted this place to be a new go to restaurant for us to frequent. The yelp reviews and the food pics were just what we were looking for. It has a great location and the service was excellent, but their food on this experience spoke a different language.   We had the HALIBUT & LOBSTER OSCAR and the SEARED SCALLOP & AHI. For two $25+ plates these should have been delicious, especially noting that the Oscar dinner was one of their signature dishes on the menu. The Halibut and the vegetables were great, however, their could have been a little bit more lobster and a little less of that thermidor sauce. Overall the dish seemed to be a bit bland, but had enough food to fill you up, had it been tastier. The Scallop & Ahi dish was also disappointing as well. First thing we noticed was the lack of food on the plate for $25. It had a very scarce arugula bed and the vegetables seemed to be an after-thought. The scallops were fine, but the yellow fin was ruined by this extremely peppery rub that over powered the flavor of the fish. It was just too much!   I really hope this was just a one-off visit. I want to give this place another try, but convincing the other half will be very difficult with this experience being our first one. First impressions really set the mark. Very disappointing...

fWXDaGWOzk6_77zS9aPXzw.text: Incredible menu and great kitchen to mouth service execution! Deserts are rockin too!

t5mDSKReFkm575sPpkaxiA.text: Great atmosphere, delicious food. I recommend calamari for an  appetizer. The salmon was excellent. I saw some other items on the menu that I will try in the future. Definitely worth trying and the staff was very attentive.   Nothing bad to say.

SSFotnkh0PheHp1VjaAiMg.text: Great menu selections and good food.  BUT beware of the hours!  Posted business hours are until 10 pm but we have visited twice, and NOT SO MUCH.  First time, arrived 9:20 pm and was told at front door that they are closed because they haven't had a customer in the last half hour so they are done for the night and we should go down the street to try RA Sushi or ZTejas instead. (wow, really?)  Second time, arrived and seated at 8:45 pm, ordered and received food.  Ordered more food and server returned to inform us that kitchen has already thrown out all food and closed for the night.  It was 9:25 pm. Then they proceeded the clean up throughout the restaurant and had all the chairs on the tables by 9:45 while we were still there!  If you don't want the patrons or business then change your posted hours!

_vttnUUZx4n3y8U-gNzr-w.text: Two tries. On our first visit, we shared two great appetizers, lobster tots and the calamari. Both were so delicious and inventive, I had super high expectations that were dashed by the sushi rolls, fried shrimp in almost every roll, cream cheese which belongs nowhere near sushi, IMHO.  We decided to give it a second try, due to the appetizers, and try other items. The shrimp and avocado crisp was good tasting but not crisp in the least and lacked avocado. Lots of shrimp though.  The salmon Caesar was really good but huge.  My husband ordered the Captain Crunch fried ice cream. Expected a crunchy crust, not even close.  I ordered a glass of over priced Chardonnay that was so bad I had to ask for a glass from a new bottle.

mKJWiq8YBZfY61bSeGPfaA.text: I absolutely love this place. Awesome service, great food, yummy drinks, and the decor is on point. Whoever decorated it and came up with the theme did an exceptional job. Prices seemed fair for what they serve and the presentation. Good sized portions. I would definitely recommend this place and we will be going back!

5dzc_YGemQ3w1KLT16kZ-g.text: Nothing bad to say about this place! Everything from the service, to the food, and prices are fantastic (especially during their all day happy hour on Sunday!) For my first visit I went with the ceviche, and Mango Tango sushi. I will definitely be coming back here to try out some other dishes!!

Ax8LQDXXgCfGFM_TKDRTHQ.text: Everything we've tried here is incredible. The mango shrimp tacos.. the diablo roll.. ahi tuna salad, you can't go wrong. We took our family here while they were visiting and on their last night here they asked "can we just go back to smokin fins?!"

Everything that we ordered came out just the way we wanted. Our server, Andi M., was such a pleasant individual to accompany our meal and Sarah R., the operating partner, gave us outstanding service. DEwLsS7oY6b8vNSauHq7jQ.text: I came in for lunch last Friday.  The atmosphere is nice, the waitress was great and the food was very good.  I tried one of the salad bowls and it was fantastic. I would highly recommend Smokin Fins for lunch or dinner.

P-1cEKUkXFmg9ZnX_Nv1Uw.text: The first half of review (lunch) is from 9/30/17. I moved it to close a duplicate account. The SECOND part (Brunch) is current- Nov 2018  Part 1: I only had the calamari and the roasted poblano soup - but Wow! Both delicious.  Indeed the calamari is light and crispy-tasty. That soup- to die for!  I will be back-and ready to scarf I sat at the bar, and Meg B was a wonderful waitress.   She was a good singer too! Fun gal .  Nice ambiance ...not busy for a Sat. I hope they stay in business! Seems robbed a tough corner; I've watched several restaurants come and go.   The name seemed weird- but I'm sold - on the food  I can't wait to come back. And, come back I DID! _______________________ Part 2:  Came back once before, but chickened out and had the same thing, this time, I got braver and ordered Huevos Rancheros (from a seafood restaurant?)  OH YES!  When I read the corn tortillas were from scratch-I had to try it.   Man-it was so delicious. Those tortillas were so moist and really tasted like... CORN! Novel indeed.   The eggs were cooked perfectly. The setting is beautiful and the service was very good.   I will be back for Brunch again for sure. Who knew?

cr4WvpQZVL6x8yu9Z69yxQ.text: It's happy hour all day Sunday which was the day we went. Sat at a booth near the bar and outside. Started with the 6 oysters for $12. My English muffin was a bit hard at the bottom but the egg yolk helped make it soft in the middle. Came with a side of fruit which I thought could be more fresh but it was ok. My friend ordered some items from the happy hour and the calamari was yummy. I tried some of her calamari and the devil eggs looked good too. It was a good spot for our oysters fix.

V0uBPQGqDf797GQJ6sg5NA.text: We stopped in at 11am on a Saturday, the place was pretty slow as they had just opened and the weather was perfect for dining on the patio. Our server was very sweet and helpful, recommending a few items since it was our first time visiting. We had the lobster stuffed avocado, which had a surprising kick, edamame, California roll and the lobster Mac n cheese. Mac n cheese was so creamy and delicious and had plenty of lobster meat  our waiter recommended the mango cake after and holy cow it was phenomenal! Definitely recommend saving room for a slice, although, (fair warning) a "slice" is seriously enough to feed 4. We had to stop ourselves from finishing the thing. The restaurant does seem a little pricey so it won't be someplace we visit frequently but there are a few more items I'd like to try off the menu when we have another occasion to visit :)

SUMBPQsIO8o8yBlPiiLg_w.text: #666  Hosnaps!  Check out that number!  Sizzle!  Devil!  Hiss!  Fire!  Diablo!  ...Rock & Roll?!?  I couldn't figure out what I wanted to write for my 666th review.  I was thinking about a place with the word "Devil" in it but the closest I got were janky places that were Sun Devil related.  Then I was thinking about a spicy place but I kept running across Szechwan food which I admit isn't my favorite.  One thing led to another and I landed on Smokin Fins.  This place sounds both cute and super delicious without me having to burn my culo.  And even better, this is where I celebrated my birthday!   I had ordered the Brussels & Cauliflower [Brussel sprouts and cauliflower flash fried with blue cheese crumbles, bacon, and smoked sea salt. $9.99], Platinum Roll [Crab and cucumber inside topped with Salmon, Ahi Tuna, Hamachi, and Ebi Shrimp with layers of lobster-crab salad, spicy aioli, green onions, and tobiko. $14.99], and two alcohol beverages [a Spiced Mule and a Smokin Gun].  And what's even sweeter, the waitress brought me Tempura Ice Cream for dessert since my friends told her it was my birthday when she asked if we were celebrating an occasion.  How thoughtful!   My food was amazing.  I am absolutely in love with that Brussels & Cauliflower appetizer.  It was salty, the texture was crispy, and the bits of bacon and blue cheese gave all the vegetables a nice explosion of flavor. The Platinum Roll was tasty and I enjoyed every bite.  It's one of their signature rolls.  I also got to try my friend's Seafood Risotto and it was so delicious.  It had just enough white wine to make my skirt flip!  I also ate half a Blackened Cod Fish Taco which had good flavor.  The Key Lime Calamari was also quite impressive.  Lightly coated calamari rings, perfectly fried, and served with a side of key lime aioli.  Yum!  As for the Lobster-Crab Stuffed Mushrooms, wow!  They're small but packs a lot of flavor.  The decor was gorgeous.  We were seated at a long table by the back patio so it was a tad on the warmer side.  As the skies got darker, the lighting made the ambiance nicer.  I had a great night with some of my favorite people in the world.  Thank you for a great birthday dinner, Smokin Fins!   I would love to come back to try their other dishes!   A fish should swim three times --- in water, in butter, and in wine!

tg20njuTxImPaykRSyTRlg.text: Well, this was my first visit. I arrived around 3:30 and I was the only one at the bar. There were a few other patrons scattered around the restaurant. In my Yelp search I put in "Happy Hour Margaritas" near my current location.  Smokin' Fins came up saying it was within 10 minutes from me.  So I gave it a try.   Happy Hour prices food range from $6 - $12.  I was torn between trying the Smokin' Nachos or the Crispy Brussels & Cauliflower. The Crispy Brussels & Cauliflower dish is flash fried Brussels and Cauliflower with blue cheese crumbles, bacon and sea salt. I asked the bartender which dish did she prefer, she said Crispy Brussels so that's what I went with.  The food took a while to come out.  As I was sitting there starting to wonder where my food was, I heard the bartender ask someone to check on it.  I ordered my second drink before my food came out.   It smelled delicious when it was placed in front of me.  First bite, yummy - but salty!  My first bite I made sure to have a piece of everything on my fork.  The flavors were awesome.  I took a few more bites, same thing - a bit too salty.  Also, for a flash fried dish, it was heavy in grease. Maybe it was the bacon, not sure.  All the flavors together are out of this world good.  I think they should do without the added sea salt because the bacon gives it more than enough salt.  For the drinks ... prices range from $4 - 8 bucks.  I'm not a Corona girl, so I asked if I'd be able to get a regular Margarita on Happy Hour. The bartender said "Sure".  I wasn't informed there would be an upcharge.  No big deal, but I think it should have been mentioned.  The Margarita she made me was only OK, my second drink was simply Tequila with a splash of Sprite because again, the Margarita was only OK. Overall, I wouldn't visit Smokin' Fin again alone for Happy Hour.  It's kinda boring.  Some place you can go alone and don't feel alone because the food, service and atmosphere is awesome, this was not the case with Smokin' Fin.  I'd return, but with friends.

guWmnu0piMJUxDqzbigs3Q.text: Let me start off by saying im not the biggest seafood or sushi guy, but my family loves it. We went the other day and this place is pretty dang good. Pricey, but good. mSlrPfwgmt2aS8YA6PiQaA.text: My wife and I enjoyed the Smokin fins environment. It was our date night and the decor was excellent. I really enjoyed our waiters demeanor. Once our hostess was escorting us to the table and I saw where it was located I asked for a booth. The table was literally in the middle of everything and the intimacy was not there. I will be coming back for a second time.

JRCvoJhIsXjK_asuD5UdRw.text: First time at smokin fins for a birthday lunch. I had a spicey tuna roll and the diablo roll. Both were very good as was the fresh tortilla chips and chi polte sauce. VidfG9PWXiAQc8ShG2X4xA.text: The atmosphere is nice but too bad it's too hot out to enjoy the awesome fire pit on the patio. We went here for dinner on Saturday night because my husband wanted sushi. We started with the calamari which was tasty and then shared the "el diablo" sushi and Khalua pork. All food was great! Service was excellent. Our sever recommended an awesome Malbec. Lhebmh4oFtd4sDAGJ-BQgQ.text: A little pricey, but the lobster Mac and Cheese was so good. Nice chunks of lobster. Enough for my husband and I to share with an appetizer before. The mushrooms we're good too! We will be back!

_J04Rk4dIHrvgu5IFjYXjg.text: I was looking for a new place for my friend and I to try so, as usual, I turned to Yelp. Impressed with the reviews here, I decided to try Smokin Fins. The folks here did not let me down! Only opened since March of this year, this little gem is sure to become a favorite spot. The atmosphere is upbeat and fun yet comfortable. The server was friendly, well informed, and checked on our table just the right amount of times. The menu has a nice variety but at the same time was not overwhelming. The food is fun and unique and so, so, so delicious. We had the avocado and shrimp crisp, fried calamari, lettuce wraps and edamame. Each dish was cooked perfectly and the portions were just right. So happy to have found a new restaurant! Cannot wait to return!!

YZaaK8RmaPmWwZFWKvbgbQ.text: Happy to welcome this unique place to the neighborhood. The name doesn't do it justice but the extensive menu made it difficult to choose.   The rich and buttery poached crab was fantastic albeit a bit pricey for an appetizer. We tried the highly touted calamari and were satisfied but not overly impressed as they are with it. The lobster quesadilla was a crazy combination of flavors that worked.   Interesting "icetinis" served in ice glasses and a few other creative cocktails make it worth a revisit.

o50k-lEZ9nG7XYPOx1hvjA.text: No need to go to Scottsdale for ambience, class, quality, service, and amazing food from a different and varied menu. The atmosphere is so perfect with choice of inside/outside/sports bar including fire pits. Prompt seating and perfect service. 6 of us had Asian, BBQ, salad etc. plus excellent appetizers and drinks. Desserts to die for. Great evening, we'll be back.

NqlAyabUzQjcJyQu4ALmxQ.text: This was my first visit, it will not be my last.  We ordered the calamari, brussel sprouts, and deviled eggs.  Good lord they are all delicious. For my main I ordered the fish and chips perfectly cooked and delicious.  My recommendation is try try try!!!

6aLaUV6AAMnwcTmlrJIfww.text: I really don't understand how this place has such good reviews.  I saw the reviews and decided to go.  The server was nice.  The two drinks I got both did not taste as expected, but I just thought it was me.  he was fast enough so i was happy. Then we got a few small meals to share. Lobster tater tots were good, the best part of the meal.  Fried potatoes with seafood.  Can't go wrong.  The rest of the meal went wrong.  Stuffed Avocados tasted like mayo and fake crab, but still weren't that bad.  The Key Lime calamari was over cooked and like rubber.  The Brussels sprouts were so oily I stopped eating them.  How do you mess up brussels sprouts?  then the sushi.  The tropical lobster roll. It was a bad California roll topped with fruit.  The lobster had almost no taste, someone i was with said it tasted like water.  And the Dragon role was not much better.   I was very sad because I love seafood and was hopeful that it would be as good as the menu was.  Sorry to say we won't be back.

SgiJfyoJXbLXcbWG0xv9iw.text: Stopped for a late lunch...shrimp rice bowl was very good and same for Key West Cobb salad. Miso soup was good but could have been a bit warmer. Service was top notch and drinks were hand poured and generous. Would definitely stop again.

7k0b3I_MQpfm104-f8cvnQ.text: Awesome lunch spot! Been here multiple times, sometimes twice a week, and love their sushi. Fresh, flavorful, and not to bad priced. Good patio when weather is great, waiter/waitress always attentive and served quick.   Try them, you'll thank me!

s8q9xzFoA-JvmuQeydf_xg.text: This is my second time eating at this spot.  Being that it's so close to where I get my nails done I thought why not try it. My daughter and I like new places and being a person who eats and loves seafood Smokin Fins is right in my aisle of foods.  Was quite impressed to see they have sushi as well (wishing they had eel sauce) so my daughter was pleased. The California rolls are quite delicious. Haven't been dynamic enough to try any other rolls but I did have the shrimp scampi and even though it's not made with Alfredo sauce it's very good.  The ambience of the restaurant is small but quaint it has a very nice bar and table seating is comfortable. I'd highly recommend the place. Looking forward to trying new dishes. Definitely a 4star joint.

ZjBUnsJgdeQcXsYKMooBuA.text: Stopped in on a Friday night with a friend and we sat at the bar. We did the same last time we were here. The place usually has a decent amount of customers, but I wouldn't call it busy/packed. It's a nice casual place to grab food and drinks with friends or coworkers - mostly adults. The bartenders were nice but I did feel like the service was somewhat slow considering the fact that the bar was only half full.   They have some pretty tempting appetizers - last time we tried the lobster tator tots and they were delicious. This time we tried the Kickin' Shrimp which came with a lot of shrimp - would be good for sharing with a group. I prefer the tots, but those are a smaller portion so they would be best split between two people (or all to yourself!)   For a meal, I wasn't too hungry so I grabbed the BLT Wedge salad (which is labeled more as a side salad). The produce was fresh and the bacon was amazing. I would recommend if you are looking for a lighter meal (or if you fill up on apps!)

qNEGWAm9AVjxVMbKllDD1g.text: We ordered from here via Yelp delivery so I won't speak to the service level. What I will rally for is the flavors of the restaurant. The edamame was perfectly cooked. Plump beans with a great seasoning dipped in a house soy sauce. Not slimy. Seemingly not frozen because of the bright green color and lack of freezer burn. My entree was their house fettuccine shrimp scampi. The tail-on shrimp were large, seasoned to perfection and a top a bed of garlic and light butter cream noodles. Most restaurants hold back on the meats and seafood. Not with this dish. It could feed two easily.  I was overly surprised on the dishes even after a delivery. They came hot and steaming. My next move is to dine at the restaurant after this try-out.

LlQviZ_ULMINmddMsjXrpw.text: This was an impromptu birthday lunch for my husband while we were at the Lexus dealership with my mom. We got hungry and decided to get a quick bite. Saw the good reviews on good ole Yelp and it didn't disappoint.   First: you gotta be a fan of sushi and coastal inspired Mexican food. The name after all is Smokin Fins, so think seafood inspired meals with a kick! I have to admit I've never come across a restaurant that serves a wide array of specialty sushi rolls AND decent tacos.   Second: the selection is endless, I saw things on the menu from burgers to lobster Mac and cheese to edamame appetizers. It's very unique and you're in for a flavor adventure, so keep an open mind. I'm sure there's something for everyone, so this place seems like it's versatile in satisfying a group with picky palates.   Ambiance was great, the lighting was all updated and beautiful. There's a decent sized full bar and everyone was very friendly.   The bathroom in the ladies room was clean but the lock on the door was broken. Our food room a bit longer than expected to come out and it wasn't busy when we went.   Overall, I'm going to try this place again next time I'm in the area. Such a refreshing concept to incorporate sushi and modern coastal inspired Mexican cuisine.

wIhr907lK6aqdSyIlYGOMw.text: My my my! I liked this spot!   Aesthetically, the exterior is nice and the interior is very pretty!  Gorgeous light fixtures and rich wood shelves stocked with vino.  It was a bit loud in there though.  Booths are comfortable.  Everything was clean.  The service was excellent! My waitress was attentive and answered all my questions about the menu with confidence. She was super friendly and didn't bug me all.  Also very efficient.  K, best part: the food!  To start, I had the Bloody Mary, which I've never ordered at a restaurant before, but this one was garnished with bacon and shrimp so I had to try it. Because bacon.  It was spicy and delicious!  For my entree, I had the pistachio halibut with smashed potatoes and asparagus. I didn't even try the asparagus because I got so wrapped up in the halibut and potatoes! Both were to die for.   So why I give 4 stars and not 5, you ask? Because of the prices!  $28 for pistachio halibut? Really? Come on. I would have expected to pay $20, or at the most $23, but $28 is dumb.  That said, I know there's no logic in what I'm about to say, but I'd so order that again. It was just that good. So, I guess it's worth the $28.    For dessert, upon the waitress's recommendation, I had the bread pudding. I normally do not eat bread pudding cuz it's weird to me.  But this was bread "pudding" on steroids. It was big, it had chocolate chips in it, bourbon sauce, AND ice cream! I died. This is me writing a review from beyond.   If you're in the Chandler area, I absolutely recommend eating here!! Do et. You will not be disappointed!

wKyPgYxSrEYsi_jiIeAZOw.text: Decided to have a late lunch, Happy Hour was included.  First off, the lighting was so poor we could not read the menu and the happy hour offering differed greatly from Fin's website.  No light, so we ordered fish and chips.  It was fine but the French fries were frozen.  The fish was greasy.  My husband ordered a key lime pie to go.  It took forever.  It was pulled from the freezer.  Three stars because the Kona draft was great   Women's restroon was dirty at 3:30 pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Fish and chips

gqwvJ6R1N8Q9tg2XHQtAqg.text: Decided to try Smokin Fins out on a Monday night and I'm so glad we did!  I looked over the menu before arriving so I already knew I wanted to get the Lobster Tots and Fish and Chips. I'll get to just how great they both were in just a second.   I arrive around 530 pm so happy hour was still going on until 6pm. I took advantage of getting the Fins Mule at the happy hour pricing of $7. The mule was in a very large cup and certainly worth the price!  There's plenty of liquor inside so 1 or 2 should be a good start for anyone.   The Lobster Tots arrived about 10 minutes after ordering them. They were so delicious. I really liked the ranch dip and the zesty/spicy flavor of both the tots and ranch together. I will say that the mesh of flavors kind of overpower the lobster taste but still everything taste very good!  The Fish and Chips were the star of the show. I got the salmon and I was so happy that it was battered like fish and chips should be. You have a choice of Cod, Salmon, or Halibut all ranging in price. I'm pretty hooked on the Salmon but I would be open to trying the other options as well. The fries we seasoned nicely and came with a side of ketchup for dip. I dipped them in the tarter sauce as well which made for a great combination.   The total for 2 drinks, Appetizer, and 2 entrees came out to just around $60 bucks. Smokin Fins is certainly a great bang for your buck!

Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Fins Mule
Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Lobster tots

R-WihxiG38mNgt1wdGi-oA.text: Smokin Fin is a restaurant chain around the US with somewhat of a fusion or at least what I consider a mesh of cuisines.  They have restaurants name like Naked Fins, Lucky Fins, and of course Smokin Fins.   With influence of Asian, Mexican, and Northwestern cuisine; Smokin Fins definitely doesn't lack in the option department on their menu.  We started with a basic edamame; which was as I described.  The moved on to their Brussel Sprouts and Cauliflower appetizer; which is probably my favorite because of the sea salt and their Chimi-Ranch dressing.  For my entree I ordered their Hatch Green Chili Chicken tacos.  Overall, the most intriguing this was the house made corn tortilla; fluffy and thick, but not too dry.  I was somewhat disappointed though because I expected a uber kick because in New Mexico; them Hatch Chili's were no joke, but damn kicked my ass.  I didn't get that here on my tacos, but still okay.    In the end Smokin Fin was a solid place and probably better for a good HH down in the Ahwatukee area.  Service was good and the ambiance was chill, but not too rowdy.  -- Enjoy!

N7GBM-YquWryzdg021kmbw.text: Went in today to try out their Happy Hour menu. My wife said this is now her most favorite Happy Hour place. We had 3 different orders of street tacos, an order of Tune Tataki, and the fried brussel sprouts and cauliflower. Everything was delicious! We both couldn't stop eating the brussel sprouts and cauliflower. It has bacon and blue cheese crumbles on it, with some blue cheese dressing on the side. I'm picky about blue cheese, and this stuff was fantastic. Not to much bitter bite like many blue cheeses have.   The service was fantastic, and the open atmosphere of the restaurant is very inviting. This will now be our go-to Happy Hour place. There's some there for whatever food your in the mood for.  Edit - I've been coming to this place for about a year at least once a month. Today I meet an old friend there, and our service was poor. The food quality seems to be dropping, and the prices on their new website don't match the prices in the restaurant. Neither does the menu offerings. The website shows several things not listed on their menu, and the prices are $1 to $3 dollars more in the restaurant. The first time I saw this a few weeks ago I blew it off, but now a month later there's no excuse for these errors.  Their happy hour isn't that happy anymore because of this issue. This place lost my favorite place to go status today.  VERY SAD! I HOPE THEY GET NEW MANAGEMENT SOON!

xqbmCPgDvgKxBKyAN7jV3Q.text: Met up with my boyfriend here for dinner. He got there first and he said that he was waiting in front to be seated for like 10 mins and no one greet him. He decided to just walk in because he needs to use the restroom and then one of the waitress asked if he have been helped yet. He said "no" so they seated him. Then I came in and I thought the restuarant look nice and fancy.   My boyfriend ordered the old fashion while he was waiting for me. We think it was interesting because they added 2 small pieces of bacon in it, but it tasted fine. I wouldn't recommend to have bacon in the drink just because after awhile, you can see the drink looks oily. They should've just put 2 bacon on the toothpicks and stick on top of the drink so that it still stay crispy and not soggy. We ordered the key lime calamari with the signature key lime aioli. It was very delicious and I love the crispiness of the breaded calamari. Then we order the entree, my boyfriend orderd the 48 Hour Nashville Chicken, which we feel disappointed. We think Popeyes look better than this. It was just 2 small plain chicken breast breaded. It was the most plain and blanded chicken we ever pay this much for and it was $14.99. We could've just went to churches chicken or Popeyes for better chicken for less than $14.99. And it came with the sides of mac n cheese and Cesar salad. The mac n cheese was plain and blanded as well. I ordered the seared ahi salad, I think it's very delicious and light, and I love the dressing.   The service was ok. She doesn't put a smile on her face and hardly start a conversation. She just came to take the order and left hurriedly.  I wouldn't recommend or come back to this restaurant. Its expensive and stuff that they serve, we could've done it at home or find somewhere else better. By the way, my boyfriend went home unsatisfied and still hungry.

_m2GirnnMGDliKF4Sfor9Q.text: Stopped in last night with my roommate. The food was good, but what I'll remember is the service we received from Stephanie.  What an incredibly friendly waitress. I'd be back for sure just to see her. She was so attentive to us - I was admittedly hungover so I was drinking water like crazy and my glass was never empty. A female manager also stopped in to check on us, didn't catch her name but she was nice too.  As for the food, def try the lobster stuffed avocado appetizer (pic attached)!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Sushi
Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Lobster stuffed &amp; deep fried avocado

Q9cx-5FYftuieZeEBoXuyA.text: I was in the east valley working and took the opportunity to meet a friend at this unique, fun restaurant.  We sat in the bar. The stuffed avocado was the perfect snack on a hot day!  The service was stellar! I'm hoping they open one near north Phoenix or Scottsdale!

luATQlBqi9Z-Ct9keflOOA.text: Oofenschtein. What the heck is the menu concept here?  Hamburger helper to 52 day aged prime?  Lobster?  Imitation crab more like it. This menu has ADD, look squirrel. It has something for every major food category.   El Paso isn't just a city in Texas, it's what you should do if you're thinking about coming here!    Our service was at least friendly and helpful but the food is another whole train wreck.  I had the Nashville chicken. It came out dry and half battered. Me thinks it was double cooked.....  asked for some extra hot sauce that they used for the chicken and got some franks red hot - which thankfully I like.   I subbed the mashed taters for "truffle fries".  I wasn't born yesterday but those were regular fries dusted with some green stuff.  The Mac n cheese - made the same way you make nachos. Sprinkle shredded cheese on top and microwave.    If your looking for good food or a good date night, keep on shopping for another stop.

sapiX4oKFGD7j3O-qf93dg.text: Lobster-stuffed avocado, Pecan-crusted halibut, Bourbon pudding something dessert, Good drinks, Excellent service. So delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bourbon pudding dessert

koTMoPcKMN6vQVDLuelCtw.text: The power poke is amazing! I wanted to start with ambiance, decor, etc, but my food is so delicious! The wine list looks awesome, too bad I'm on my lunch hour. They have Cline Zinfandel, one of my favorites. Full bar with some great liquor choices (Titos, a rye whiskey, lots of other vodkas...) The beer selective looks decent, but I'm not a specialist. I love the decor. Not crazy about the exclusive country playlist, but maybe that changes up... I'm definitely putting this on my return list, especially with the husband.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Power poke

ynqHgqGZnAtWDgi_0uNi0g.text: This was my first time at Smokin Fins today. We were greeted immensely and seated promptly. The decor had an upscale feel to it. The ambiance was a bit romantic with dim lights. Our server checked on us often, was nice and kind. We ordered the Kickin Shrimp and Calamari for appetizers. The Kickin Shrimp was sweet and spicy. It was delicious! The dipping sauce was really good also. The Calamari was cooked perfectly and seasoned well. It had a nice crunch to it.  My daughter ordered The California Rolls. She said they were really good! I ordered the Shrimp Scampi Pasta. The shrimp were juicy and a nice size.The pasta was cooked well. I really like the cheese flavor in the dish. Yummy! It just needed salt and pepper.  Overall, we had a really good experience. Good food, atmosphere and service. I'll be back to try the bottomless mimosas with my girlfriends on Saturday or Sunday 11am-2pm. I'd  definitely like to try some other dishes. They have a wide variety of selections. I don't think you'll be disappointed in Smokin Fins.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Shrimp Scampi Pasta
Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Calamari
Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Kicking shrimp! Sweet and spicy. Really good!

BlqbIv_llBbz3wv9x86Hsg.text: We went here for lunch from work, with a group of around 15 people, and I must say, I liked this place a lot. Starting from their appetizers to their entrees, the quality of food and service was top notch. We ordered the calamari and lobster tater tots for starters, and both were delicious. Their entrees are served in quite generous portions, and is definitely more than just filling! I ordered the blackened fish tacos made with Alaskan cod, and liked it a lot. It was served on a bed of really tasty lime rice, along with a side spicy chipotle sauce. Some of the entrees my colleagues ordered included the Nashville chicken, shrimp soup bowl, and the Baja chicken salad, and they all looked amazing. The ambience is nice and calm, I would definitely recommend this place for large groups and corporate luncheons. :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Blackened fish tacos

SsLLLxtYLkUOXSQx3YC_nA.text: First time and I'm impressed. Awesome menu. Most everyone can find several things they like no matter how picky. Neat atmosphere. Enjoying thoroughly.

SRp46ZHBeFnAOKgk1i2xvw.text: This place is great- fresh tasty food and something for everyone! I got the blackened shrimp enchilada stack & ate it before I could take a photo! Trust me it was delish. Lots of shrimp, excellent textures & fresh tastes. My husband got the steak tacos- they were perfect. The atmosphere is casual but elegant. Drinks were small but delicious and the service was fantastic. We will be back to try their sushi next time!!

PQPPrX0rvvTsUZH3hmt8rg.text: I was VERY impressed with this fine establishment.  I am very picky with sushi and this place hit the spot!  Sundays are all day happy hour with great appetizers and drink specials!    If sushi portions are a big thing to you like it is to me ( I hate paying for sushi that's tiny) this place aims to please!  The rolls were thick (wink wink) and  filled us up!!   We had the platinum and the El Diablo roll both were sooooo good!  We had appetizers and drinks for happy hour specials!  I will post pics.  The sushi was buy 1 get 1 half off.. wow!  This is definitely a must go to restaurant in the east valley for sure!   I loved it!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States

Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Margarita and corona together made me so happy!  Yummy!!

N6O1ZR1b3O5P-pwRKE5wEQ.text: The food was below average. The service is worthless. Our server didn't even care to be working at this place from my observation. She was rude, she forgot to put the order in, she didn't know the beer list. We had to wait 30 minutes for 1 sushi roll and a salad that we didn't even eat. I won't be coming back.

VETVIIdYlXEUApkBDvESBA.text: Folks...I'm perplexed by how this place has four and a half stars rating. Yelp has failed me this round.   It was a Saturday night, filled with hope...a lot of hope for the Smokin Fins. We arrived around 8ish and the place was somewhat hopping. I say "somewhat" only because there's people but it's not quite packed. We were seated right away and immediately we decided on our drinks. Margarita and the Beach Bum. Both drinks sounded great on paper but left us feeling empty and sad. Beach bum lacked alcohol and had way too much syrup. Not a very well crafted cocktail at all. Already it was a sign for us to leave yet we stayed against our better judgement.   For food, we ordered calamaris, lobster tater tots, steak tacos, and southwest poki bowl. All of which were unsatisfactory to say the least. Our appetizers were salty and entrees just bland. We had to ask for sauce to help make these dishes better. It shouldn't be this way.   To all my foodies out there, skip this place. Don't be a victim of bad food and cocktails.

BNuCm01p7pEmvBaYU3MJlQ.text: I went for my birthday last week and LOVED It! The atmosphere was fun but relaxed. Delicious happy hour menu and great service from Michael, and everyone else who brought us food, etc. I'll definitely be back for sushi, drinks, zucchini!! They have a small patio area that opens up to the bar area of the restaurant. They had TVs with some basketball games on but def not a sports bar. Menu ranged from sushi, bar food/sandwiches, and snacks to steaks and seafood options. Full bar with house made drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Awesome HH menu at Smoke Fins!
Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Smokin Fins: Vegas Roll + Sunshine Roll!

oetjloHpZv2D5gzm0VkIcg.text: Chicken was so spicy I couldn't finish it. I ordered a pre-dinner cocktail, a bourbon mule, with caramel, orange liquer, and candied bacon.  I got a bourbon, with an orange slice.  I sent it back and got the same thing with a little orange liquer.  I complained again, it was a $10 drink, and the server said they were out of caramel and candied bacon.  I wasn't impressed, probably won't go back.

h2TWyzyxrOTLooKrtoEgmA.text: Absolutely outstanding! Food is off the hook and the atmosphere is fantastic. The young lady I believe is the an owner was also incredible and told us some great stories about the the quirks of the building. This is my new go to place. I highly recommend it. The Poke Bowl is a MUST have!

Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Very eclectic menu!

dEKwPy5FsoUilJ6TjrEuWQ.text: We like the variety of food/drinks, the food is of great quality, and the staff is great as well as the ambience.  As far as certain foods:     Tacos could be cooked a little longer (we have had them twice now) and they somewhat fell apart. We all prefer them crispier.    Ceviche wasn't like traditional ceviche (more like a tossed salad - dryer).  Salmon, ribeye and sides were all great as well as the California roll is all good.

Ju7ATcOrPdT1NTkLkri4Tw.text: I came here with my son today & I'm so glad I did! We both munched out on movie popcorn so we weren't too hungry but the menu looked awesome. We shared a Dragon Roll, Lobster Mac'n'Cheese, & Southwest Poki bowl. The mac/cheese had large pieces of lobster in it... usually restaurants are really chintzy with it & it had real bacon too! The sushi roll was really tasty... almost too pretty to eat! The Poki bowl was better than I thought it was going to be... LOTS of fish included... not just ahi but salmon & yellowtail. It had mixed greens, pepitos, rice, roasted corn, & edamame. We sat in the bar area & Josh served me a "nectarini"(?) made with nectarine vodka & served in a glass ice mold...quite nice. A nice, filling surprise on a Sat afternoon

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Lobster Mac&#39;n&#39;Cheese, Southwest Poki Bowl, &amp; Dragon Roll.... OUTSTANDING!

JsPbfeTNTdUYRSAEB7JDFQ.text: One of the top 2 restaurants in Arizona. The other one being firebirds. This was our first time to Smokey fins and were really impressed. We live in goodyear and will be making the trip back out here. The atmosphere is great. The menu wide selection there is something for everyone. We did smoked ribs great. And the cedar salmon was excellent. The prices were perfect 2 adults 1 child 54 dollars out the door. I'm telling you Im A picky person and not one thing I would change.

o-ooFlmzMritXQlAlJV-Ew.text: I have been here twice since they have opened and both times have been great experiences...They clearly know what they are doing here.  I have read they are part of a chain, but from the good quality it tastes like someone's personal effort.  I'll be here often!!!

I don't know that it needs both cheese and sour cream. Calamari are tasty but could be more crisp and I don't love a creamy dipping sauce. We asked for Thai ginger sauce instead.

f3saNem484Qfb6cN2neO-Q.text: Great food, great service and a great happy hour!!  Try the Atomic sushi roll - it is yummy!

vAetOPDCr01MyC8gxuo-Zg.text: So excited for this restaurant,  we saw it being constructed and was a very fast renovation.   Very Impressive decor , staff is friendly and knowledgeable!  We started with the lobster tater tots (awess) entrees were sea scallops and ahi & kahlua pig both absoultly mouth watering. Sea scallops paired lovely with my favorite wine Kim Crawford . Our server Chelsea was amazing and knew exactly what was the best! thanks well be back for sure

2_jYyL6on0oEW44AVt3STQ.text: I'm here on business and was taken here for dinner and I can't wait to come back. We had a feast of shrimp tacos, lobster crab stuffed mushrooms burger seafood nachos and it was a taste explosion. You gotta try this place!

0xOnUto5xTEeIA57ZbqMbA.text: We discovered this fairly-new local place after picking our car up from a repair and checking Yelp reviews, and what a great find!! Smokin Fins has an extensive menu of tempting items, and while we stuck to appetizers and drinks this time, we'll definitely be back to try more great things on the menu. The atmosphere, which includes an indoor-outdoor patio, couldn't be better. Our waitress, Cierra, was very friendly and helpful, and we especially enjoyed interacting with the manager, Nate. The food and drinks were delicious and we definitely felt valued as patrons - something that is sometimes hard to find. This is one of our new favorite spots and there is no doubt we'll be back with friends and out-of-town guests!

dU5Y9u3ZItnr-O3Y-MXJQw.text: I love love love this place.  I come here as often as I can.  All day Sunday happy hour.  AMAZING drinks!!! Try the Smokin Gun if you like whiskey.  Lobster tater tots of friken awesome for an appetizer.  Same with lobster Mac n Cheese for a meal. The atmosphere couldn't be better for a relaxed yet not sloppy feel.  Music is chill. Service is on point,  strong drinks and I've never had to wait.

The place is nicely renovated from the place before and service is great even though they just opened on Monday. Also the chocolate spoon cake was amazing, if you love chocolate(me)!!!! Overall this is must try.

Qq7bxmP-kYb7Kf6y2YYlJQ.text: My favorite place to head to after work! Great food AMAZING sushi! Enjoy fire pits and icetinis. The service is always impeccable

Jz2vqexNO90g2ou9FizaZQ.text: Awesome,  everything we ordered was great.  Lobster Tater tots,  Kahlua pig,  Atomic roll.  We will be coming back.  Order an icetini for a special treat.

S73prMx5T6-LD_KcluJ0Dg.text: I've been here a number of times and have to say each time it is really good. Their happy hour is great and on Sundays there's all day happy hour, always a bonus. Their sushi is comparable to any other sushi place and they have probably 8 different rolls on their menu. They do tacos which are sooooooooo good and then rice bowls. The cilantro lime rice is delicious. They have these lobster tater tots that are very yummy. I really enjoy the halibut it's served in a cream sauce with asparagus and some cauliflower mash and I thought it was a top seller but it wasn't on the menu tonight which I have to say was disappointing but the tacos were still great. The Nashville chicken is amazing. They put a little spice in the batter and it's a white breast no bone. Perfection. The only problem with this dish is there wasn't enough chicken I think they should have done 2 pieces especially with the price. The patio is always packed which is a great sign. The midterms are a little more intense then they probably need to be but I get it, it's Arizona.

2hDSZy3XHIEYB9Jrm-JnMg.text: Wonderful menu/a nice variety. I tried the Kobe Tacos and Tri Tip - loved it! The atmosphere is better than average and the staff is very friendly.

3T-5jdyfs9xkZpidXJnjVg.text: Was here on business travel and decided to give this place a go. What a gem! I'll definitely be back. Great food with eclectic options.  Lobster tater tots? Hell yeah I want some of those! Delicious.

aCrCSJwnC0yQB0V-ZV4gDQ.text: The atmosphere is wonderful and the food is to die for!!! Sooooo good! If you like seafood and sushi, you'll love it here!

tleecixWMd8TslKbRgfyMA.text: We tried this new restaurant tonight and we were very impressed! Great service, took a reservation, and they fly their seafood in daily! I can vouch for their lobster MAC n Cheese. Very tasty!

8CG32p6w-n2LnqVtRXXGig.text: We tried this place today for the first time and we were very disappointed. The service was good and the kids meals were huge but the sushi was NOT GOOD. The rolls were sloppy to say the least. The pieces were so big you couldn't fit them in your mouth and they were drenched in sauce. I would expect more for the average price being 13 dollars per roll. We will not be returning and I would not recommend this place to anyone!

iZfgGn-JFsDS4q4Ks8lYpg.text: Great variety and choices. I love this place. Will always come here when in Chandler area. Thank you for the great food and price.

zvvtzFrKJP_XvrXgUyVKbQ.text: This place was amazing all the way around great food great service friendly enjoyed the whole experience tremendously. Sara was awesome will definitely be back.

3_jnjOCkNbana3MYwFWxgw.text: SF-I really enjoyed your food. I have to take a star off for poor grammar and deceptive ad practices. I don't know what a smoked fin is, but I sure as heck didn't see it on the menu. We had the lobster stuffed avocado which was some kind of treat that must have been concocted by a team of scientists hell bent on making this a better world. The smokin mac cheese was very good, but how's about a little more andouille sausage? Give it up Mr. Fin (if that's your real name). Oh, and give those scientists a raise!

sSN0YnWqApE4qxdBVBnsYA.text: We were very skeptical after assuming this location had a curse on it. Barcelona, Big Fat Greek, Mongolian BBQ, Stingray Sushi...All failed for various reasons. Thought SF was another attempt at a sushi joint, but was pleasantly surprised. Didn't know it was a chain with diverse menu and decided to give it a try. Tried sushi, Blue Point Oysters, lobster deviled eggs, shrimp avocado crisp, and our 3 year old had the Mac n cheese. Solid draft beer list and a lot of cocktail options. Zero complaints...service was super friendly, didn't even notice the chalkboard next to the bar with all the fresh seafood options on it. If sushi is not your thing there are plenty of fresh seafood options like cedar planked salmon, pistachio crusted Alaskan halibut (getting that next time), the list goes on. For having so may items on the menu they really did everything we had fantastically. Think even the pickiest of eaters could find something to enjoy here. Support it...I think this place could be around for a long time.

4vc-qPCI9ErL8GAZh4Au6Q.text: Heard rave reviews about this place and wanted to give it a try. All I can say is the food was extremely salty. Don't know the chef is heavy handed but every dish is seasoned more salt than it needs to be. I ordered the tater tots lobster, clam chowder, and a couple of rolls. By the end of the night I had 5 glasses of ice water.

JPhPxK5unphZZkTVmuytlw.text: Was looking for a place to take coworkers for a nice, but fun, environment with a large drink and food menu and this was just the place! They don't take reservations for parties under 6 but we didn't have to wait. Food was amazing, wine and beer was delicious (didn't try the cocktails). Price and service was great. Location is in a nice shopping complex but don't let that throw you off.

3GH6sBPck7W8wq7ImJtLAQ.text: Ordered their Lobster Mac & Cheese for lunch. The only lobster was the tiny pieces  of the claw, which was extremely tough and very fishy tasting.  I sent comments to Smokin Fins Chandler management and corporate office regarding my experience but no response after two weeks. Smokin Fins doesn't seem to care about their customer's experience. Service was average. Food was terrible.  Avoid Smokin Fins at all costs.

gpZ6AdvwPzOCIy1XwPxmdA.text: My mom and stepdad come here on happy hour every Friday night. I joking every once in a while and have been there for a few party diners, but the food and staff is nothing short of amazing. I recommend going during happy hour! Their happy hour is phenomenal! And honestly has the best vibe there. The only thing is happy hour can get a little loud but they have happy hour all day Sunday too! So that's a total plus! It would be a great lunch place for the family or a little date :)

0WjRKtNsnIW3wrOYfYGb7g.text: Me and my family went to the restaurant last night for the 1st time wanting to try something new and place had good reviews and now I see why, we will be definitely be going back. This place has great food, great service and there menu has something for everyone. The atmosphere is nice an clean. Im very happy we found this place. Also this place has a great happy hour as well by the looks of it.

Y0glwRtBfiFbnAcum2eBGg.text: If you are thinking this is a fish place, it's not. Not a whole lot of choices for seafood. We thought it was a bit over rated as well. The cedar plank halibut I had was appetizer sized and overly expensive for the portion you get. Had some tasty sounding things on the menu, looks like they're targeting a bar crowd to me.

dOTR35LRprBrU9CchjE9Zg.text: A friend and I decided to try Smokin Fins because we heard they had amazing sea food. We came and sat at the bar, and were immediately greeted by the bartender who was very friendly and helped us pick some of the house specialties. The food did not disappoint we started with their lobster stuffed avocado, and got entree salads and pasta and the portions were very generous and the food amazing! To top it off we tried their bread pudding which was probably my favorite item we tried. Highly recommend great food, service and atmosphere.

Fsa5SKJlC1O8NhUNrukRdg.text: Staff was very friendly and inviting! The restaurant itself had very nice decor and comfortable chairs with bright open patios that matched perfectly with the weather. The drinks we ordered (margarita and Mojito)could have been better for my liking, they lacked alcohol and flavor. The food though was exceptional! We ordered ceviche, bison cedar plank burger, and diablo roll and they were all perfectly cooked! They had vibrant full bodied flavor which I highly recommend all of them!  All this paired with attentive staff made for a great first impression. We will be back.

K9q0tuCGa8qEK95vXoOTtQ.text: Food is awesome I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu.  We couldn't decide on a sushi roll and my wife is off raw fish due to being pregnant so the chef made a his and her's!!!

iGn5Io_BmbGUvQGxDrrsbQ.text: I stopped by for dinner at this location. It's sad to say but I wasn't pleased at all! It all started with the poor attitude of the hostess. The menu looked great and appetizing which drove me here but was so disappointed! The ambiance and people were great but food was less than exceptional. I wasn't too hungry and so I ordered a light dinner. I had the fried calamari which was delish and no complaint. I had the seared tuna salad and wasn't pleased at all! The lettuce was room temperate and other veggies were soggy no crunch to it at all. The seared tuna tasted like it's been seared since opening and sitting in the refrigerator. So sad to say but how can you mess-up a salad?!?! Hopefully others had a better experience than I did. Totally disappointed!

speqxItL2UPfrxo4RLY6mw.text: My wife and I went there for lunch and I thought it was below fair at best. We were quickly seated when we arrived and greeted by our waitress who took our drink orders. She delivered our drinks and then didn't come back for almost 15 minutes before she finally took our food order. I  had tried to flag her down on numerous occasions but she would never make eye contact with us. I had to get the attention of another server asking if he would please get her over to our table. She finally shows up and asks if we would like to order drinks. I told her she already delivered our drinks bite wanted food. Not a good start. My wife ordered sushi and I had a pulled pork sandwich. The sushi was not wrapped in seaweed but rice paper and extremely dry. She said it was the worst sushi she ever had. Pulled pork usually has a sweet bbq sauce taste but mine was hot and spicy. I enjoy hot and spicy but not with pulled pork. Just not a very good lunch. We have no reason to go back there.

Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States

IpSBcuvak0P6UqqIxHi6UQ.text: Great experience at Smokin Fins.  We were planning on going to Tokyo Joe's but changed our mind. So glad we did!! We were treated amazing.  From the assist Manager Sarah and our nice young waitress Cierra! We were so impressed that we had dinner there 2 nights in a row.   If you're ever in Chandler, Az and want to eat some great food check out Smokin Fin.The sushi, salad, tacos and drinks were amazing.

c9QoJoPMOSN-p3OtC__0bg.text: The restaurant is dimly lit and is very spacious -- it was a nice place to sit down for dinner. The waitress was nice, but the service overall was not up to par. Waters were rarely refilled, we were forgotten around the time we were expecting the check, and one of the plates was dirty. Her friendly demeanor made these things easy to brush off, but that is what is keeping this place from 5 stars.  Their beer list is short, but there are some decent options. The menu says to ask the server for beers on tap, so I am assuming they change it up often. There are plenty of interesting cocktails listed. We were pretty happy with the food. The calamari was solid, and we ordered a really good happy hour appetizer that I do not see on the menu now -- it was like a shrimp and avocado thin crust pizza, but the exact name of the dish is escaping me now.   I had the honey chipotle salmon as my entree. That was just about as good as salmon gets! The honey chipotle glaze had a great flavor and the right amount of spice.

q8nfkoj6g-3U9Rcz_meL-A.text: I had stumbled across Smokin' Fins while looking for some cool new healthier eateries in the area, and I consider this place an unknown hot spot!  It wasn't hot in the sense that it was super busy on a Saturday evening a little after 9 when we arrived (but it was literally a little warm inside - I would have appreciated a little cooler climate this time of year inside a restaurant) ... It was quite slow/empty at the time we arrived, but that is no shocker seeing how this area of Chandler is not known for a lively night life scene.   The ambiance:  I loved the chill atmosphere - it was nicely decorated, fresh, modern, trendy, hip, cool.  At first glance it appears like a cool spot to hang at that you would find in N. Scottsdale, and it was even better since they offer a reverse happy hour after 9pm Fri & Sat - love it!!!  So does Smokin' Fins live up to all the great yelp reviews?  For the most part... YESSSSS!!  For drinks: we tried a glass of Pinot Grigio and one of their seasonal mango icetinini's which was neat-o ... I've never seen one of these ice martini things before!  For eats:  we tried an order of edamame, the seared divers scallops, and chicken tacos.  The edamame was pretty standard - it's pretty hard to screw that one up!  The chicken tacos were yummy! And the scallops smoked on cedar wood with bacon ranchero sauce were amazing (nice presentation too!) - that is a lot coming from someone who loves scallops and tries them nearly everywhere he goes!  The service:  our waiter was good for the most part; always asked if everything was okay and if there was anything else he could get us (minus his screw up on the food charges)  The only slip up:  I noticed when I reviewed the bill today - that since it was happy hour we should have received the happy hour prices on the edamame and the tacos, but as you can see on the bill (picture) ... our waiter charged us the regular price on both of these items and only deducted $1 for the icetinini happy hour special.  So essentially, I ended up paying more than I should have $1 on the edamame and $8 on the Tacos.  Note that on the bill it says mahi mahi tacos, but the waiter substituted chicken in for the fish.    So with tax I probably over paid by approximately $10 ... If I return during happy hour I will double check the bill before paying and walking out.  It happens, but I won't be able to give a 5 star review based on that sort of gross negligence/lack of due diligence.  My advice to other yelpers would be to review your bill thoroughly if you come in for happy hour ...   Overall, this new local trendy hot spot earned a solid 4 star review in my book, and I will return for reverse happy hour to diligently see if my next server calculates the happy hour specials correctly on my bill  ;)

TQcEoELxKPsQyW7lJmuCMg.text: I have driven past this place numerous times and read a sign touting "freshest seafood" so I decided to go with my 2 teens.  We started with the calamari..unbelievably bland. The batter had no flavor and the dipping sauce tasted like a slightly spicy ranch dressing.  We followed with the dragon roll and platinum roll. Both were so bland and the seafood in them was almost nonexistent. Such a disappointment. We usually will stuff ourselves with sushi and we actually left about 10-12 pieces it was so bad.   I will say the staff was very friendly and attentive but I will not be returning.

qldsFMa_QCwiyyzH--k1pQ.text: It appears the Ahwatukee area has been saved from the vacuous culinary wasteland proliferated by fast food and fast food hybrid (i.e. Chipotle Mexican Grill Et Al) restaurants that plague our vista with unimaginative options -  I visited Smokin' Fins Friday, March10th and was pleasantly impressed on many levels:  ~  Quality of food, fresh, tastefully prepared ~ Creativity of food - superb and well-plated ~ Restaurant staff - professional, courteous, prompt, friendly ~ Overall experience - outstanding  I sampled several items that are noteworthy: Oysters on the half shell, very fresh; Lobster Stuffed Avocado - a brilliant flavorful item imaginatively prepared; Lobster Tater Tots - definitely does not hide the lobster content, a very innovative item; Lobster Mac & Cheese - no skimping on the lobster in this dish, it was very good - but hey, it's Mac & Cheese so while good it can't rate in the "most Innovative" category; Mahi Mahi (daily special) - was very good as well.  The fish was prepared perfectly.  Another honorable mention - The Icetini's, which are poured into a "glass" crafted out of ice (it melts away gradually into an outer vessel that supports the ice-glass).  What a clever concept.  The ambiance like the food reflects attention to detail.  It edges toward upscale without being pretentious.  In summery, it was clear that the management of this restaurant has a well thought-out concept and business plan with well-trained staff that are carefully executing their opening.  Of course, much of the True test will follow, however, by virtue of the consistency in food and service unless something seriously derails this establishment I see no reason not to expect more creative dishes and experience's from Smokin' Fins.

This is a fairly new establishment, so we'll give it some time before we try it again. Hopefully it'll improve with time.

KYu2kZdsXX4D3tltAP9mYg.text: My friend and I came here for drinks and appetizers after work and we fell in love with this place! The decor, the food, and the very impressive drinks will surely have us coming back for more! They also have an awesome outdoor patio set up that is ideal for intimate gatherings or just a late drink. The staff was also very friendly and attentive. My only complaint is how rushed we felt when the time came to clear our plates. It seemed as if our server was anxious for us to pay and leave, she came by our table numerous times inquiring about the check and it made us feel inclined to leave...even though it was a Monday night and relatively empty. Aside from that, I suppose it could be chalked up to her having a bad night, our experience outside of this was great.   P.S. I also saw the bread pudding coming out of the kitchen FREQUENTLY, I didn't try it but I most likely will next time.

bW_aLEdtduoxtrg9nUccKQ.text: This was my first time in but we were referred in. We happened to come in on a Sunday and it was happy hour all day. It gave us an opportunity to try the lobster deviled eggs, mango cups, calamari,  mango tacos, buffalo tacos, brussel sprouts, and skewers. I really liked the mango shrimp tacos and the lobster deviled eggs. The clamari was good too. Our server Nancy was polite and attentive and even gave us recommendations. I would definitely recommend!

yy9OtpFg0dVbGxImP1lRuA.text: Started off well, Asian server with the tattoo 1/2 sleeve was super nice. After taking our food order she was never seen again so I had to stop a different sever, which I HATE to do, in order to get another beer. The server that I stopped was nice and took care of it pretty quick.   Then the New England clam chowder came out and was more like Curry Clam chowder. Should be advertised as their own spin on Clam Chowder...didn't like it, literally 3 bites and couldn't eat anymore. No problem because you can't please everyone and it just wasn't to my taste, HOWEVER the manager asked about it then made the comment, "Sorry we'll take care of that."  Now I'm not into freebies nor was I looking for one, but when you make a comment such as that I was expecting to at least remove the soup cost or ask if we'd like a different soup since we didn't like it.   NOPE, neither happened.   I felt bad not leaving a tip for the 2nd server who ended up basically giving us the check and nothing else.  Literally, she did nothing else...since by the time she was assigned to our table we were done and only needed the check.   The place was NOT super packed and the male server I mentioned earlier was easily taking care of his several tables all around us and providing what appeared to be great service.   I most likely won't go back nor recommend this place. Sad too because the restaurant is nice and I work nearby so I was hoping I had found a low-key spot to enjoy happy hours and team meetings, but after this 1st visit I doubt that'll happen.  Edited to add a positive note, happy hour nachos and happy hour steak tacos were pretty dang good.

EaNwukt1iXFIte2F052sPQ.text: Great place. Love the ambiance and the area. Brian our bartender/server was very nice. Found out that he is originally from the area that we currently live in. W82myIdQ2nJqX9dxlOYEhg.text: I came here with my husband for an intimate Saturday night dinner after shopping in middle of hot July day. This is not our area so we felt like exploring. This place is classy with quality food. I ordered the unfiltered sake and a bowl of clam chowder. My husband ordered the prime steak available only on Fridays and Saturdays. We shared our plates. It was delicious !  The $8 clam chowder tasted different than what was expecting but delicious nonetheless. The $29 prime steak was juicy and tender and  perfect.  Service was courteous, attentive and just great. We sat at the bar and we eavesdrop on local conversations. Amusing. I'd come back.

dIju_XUAh3igskUxea6Pig.text: I'll start by saying the inside was very chic and the staff seemed very helpful and friendly.  However, the food itself was a little bit of a disappointment. At any rate the rolls were dry and pretty tasteless; they seemed pre-made.  I also got the deep-fried avocado, which looked amazing, but the crispy deep-fried skin to soft avocado ratio was a little off for me.  There came a point where it felt like you're just eating an avocado, which I suppose could be awesome given your taste.  All-in-all though my biggest issue was with the fish.  For a place that has fish listed in a majority of their menu, the expectations should be higher.

5vz2skR2WLHt4u55384N4g.text: I wanted to like this place, but the quality of food and service has left me looking for other options for dinner next time.  Sitting at the bar, I paid cash for my first drink while waiting for my friend.  The change from a $20 was $9 that I wasn't in a rush to grab up.  After two minutes, my change was "accepted" as a tip and disappeared so the first impression was less than expected.  Follow that with ordering one appetizer specifically to meet some diet restrictions of our group.  It failed to meet the request and was replaced quickly however, the replacement was dry and tasted like the warming shelf it has spent some time on.  Bottom line - it has potential but suspect service and blah food.  Sorry fins.

nYBJYXMfBKvG_QRyjOcWFA.text: My husband and I came to Smokin Fins for dinner. The host was nice and very quickly escorted us to our table. Shortly after our waiter came by. He was pleasant and answered our questions. However, he was all over the place. He forgot to put in my husband's order. My food also took longer than average for them to bring out. After we asked him what happened to the other order he said he wasn't sure that we wanted that so he never put in the order. Mu husband got a stake which should've been with fries as he requested but the waiter again forgot and brought mashed potatoes instead. The meat was burned and did not taste good. The price of the stake would've been normal if the tasted was good but unfortunately for that taste and the look it was overpriced!!  We were disappointed. We weren't even offered any compensation. It was 7 when we walked in and it was 8:45 when they finally brought out by husbands order that was again incorrect!  The only thing I enjoyed here was the ambiance!
