efHTZTk92bIu0xVn8RhNNQ.text: Smokin Fins has become a favorite date night spot for us. Our friend Michael who we met at another eatery is now serving up his warmth, hospitality, and kindness along with amazing food here. This place has a varied menu that delivers delicious, beautifully presented food. The lobster tots are addicting! The tacos are fantastic (that rice is off the hook good!). The burgers are delicious and the salads are fresh and flavorful. The best part is they stay just as good later. I bring half the salad home and it makes for a great work lunch the next day. How many leftover salads from a restaurant can say that? (If salads could talk) Let's talk about the desserts. So far we have had the bread pudding, mango cake, chocolate cake and they are ALL a religious experience! Do you remember Zingers? (Those gooey, chewy yummy little snack cakes) The mango cake is yummy like a Zinger but made with quality ingredients. It is like eating sunshine I swear! Getting back to service; this is a friendly place. Nadia is such a dear, sweet person and we enjoy seeing her. When you go to Smokin Fins relax because the folks there will take the time to make eye contact and connect with you. It's not fast food. We appreciate this place and know that you will too!

I-rq5KkJEfJem1GfBNgGxA.text: We've passed this place for awhile and decided to finally give it a try. When we walked in we were greeted and everyone was friendly. Atmosphere was nice too.   The menu looked great - and we saw the calamari (one of our favorites) so we knew we had to give it a try. We placed our order fairly quickly, but it took over 20 minutes to get our appetizers. Not the worst but it was also a quiet Thursday night.   The real problem started when our food came out. The calamari was cold. Not like luke-warm but actually cold. It was also mushy without much flavor.  We also got edamame which was also cold, and they didn't bring any soy sauce for it.   The sushi rolls were meh at best.   The atmosphere and everything looked so promising but don't plan on ever going back.

OlFWZXFw6XfLgt6psyS4Gw.text: My fiance and I went to this restaurant last Friday, as we always like to try new places. Based off of our first impression of the menu, we were intrigued and couldn't wait to go try it. Lucky for us, even on a late Friday afternoon and during happy hour, there was no wait. Browsing the menu a little bit more we decided exactly what we wanted, we were set on seafood. We sat down, ordered drinks and the Kick Shrimp as well as the Tuna Tataki. Immediately after, we were ready to order our entrees, which were the 2 rolls we got each.  The reason for the 4 stars is because of a bit slower service, our server seemed to be more attentive to other tables. The other reason, not sure if this was due to us coming during happy hour, but I do wish we received a bit bigger portions for the appetizers that we received. I didn't care for the iced tea, lesson learned for the next time. Overall it was a fulfilling experience and delicious. There is more that we do want to try on the menu and plan on coming back. If not earlier, then for my birthday.

Be warned, they do have some pretty solid kick, but were delicious and tasted very fresh. I got mahi mahi tacos which were on the messy side but also delicious, refreshing, nice lunch. Service was excellent and the music is good too - lots of cool remixes, excellent atmosphere. Check it out! 5*

EJxfeQy5x9Br7YyrIaqeRQ.text: Thanks again Stephanie. Best service we had on our stay in Phoenix. Ask for Stephanie!! Today we were in the area for a little shopping and found this restaurant it's on the side of a plaza ...being from California I was weary about the fish. So we check it out... it's empty but little did we know we were five minutes early from open and they let us in with welcoming arms... the manager sat us down and we immediately asked any recommendations and she gave us 4 which 3 of them we tried...first the tempura avocado half (best app by far) which was something out of this world... second we tried the special which was a grilled shrimp and strawberry salad... this is definitely for all those who agree raspberry vinaigrette is a bit to strong this was on the milder side... one recommendation is use a different salad mix rather then the garden leafs.... now to talk about the fish we had the sunset roll as well as calamari the sunset roll was outstandingly fresh as well as a nice kick of spicy to it. The calamari is a must try.... however the food was not only good but our server Stephanie guided us through the entire menu... including knowing every beer on draft... she also knew the lunch special and keep in mind we showed up right as the doors opened and she was ready for us. I thank her for making my birthday lunch amazing for my boyfriend and I.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin Fins - Chandler, AZ, United States. Sunset roll

6AcmLxFXgiDYdymsqmy9pA.text: We had a great dinner here. The food was wonderful!  We started with the crispy calamari and outstanding brussel sprouts/cauliflower appetizers. The california roll we ordered was fresh. The fish and chips were very good.  The fish was very flakey and not greasy.  The french fries were crispy and not oily. The salmon was cooked to perfection! It came with fresh roasted vegetables that were great.  The mango and shrimp tacos were very good.  There was a lot of mango which was very nice. The service was outstanding. We received a fried ice cream dessert because we were celebrating a birthday.  It too was excellent! I would recommend this restaurant for anyone wanting great food and service!

7KXT0RkD9VOBExcOcIajvQ.text: There are no big words to describe how much I loved it here! I had the California rolls, and they were absolutely mouth watering! It was my first time eating there and I have no regrets. The food was perfect, and I came home stuffed and well fed.

l97rzlFHuQgumHKwQsHlDA.text: Great outdoor patio, altho it might be too hot as it's over 105 today - May 24th - in Phoenix.  Unique, delicious selections. There's something for everybody

ZG1N5Iow40Z1zOEHThJzWg.text: We were starving when we walked in which led us to ordering more than we could eat. We had sushi, shrimp tacos, the shrimp crisp which is AMAZING, lobster Mac and clam chowder. It was all delicious and the service was good. We can't wait to go back on Sunday for ALL DAY happy hour. Prices are really great too.

wKA4Bhhe-PW4qDqADM0krA.text: Moving here from Oregon I give this place 5 stars becouse the seafood is great here! The staff is amazing and very down to earth!

mD9BpQoyJDqz4k12DmRu2Q.text: the food is amazing for such a great price! not to mention our server was very involved and recommended so many good things. everything on their menu sounded good and tasted even better. highly recommend for anyone who wants a fancy meal at a reasonable price

sjN-ci9bGg1t0bZgleWEmA.text: Felt like I was in my San Francisco bay area. The sushi exceeding my snob sushi expectations. You must try the deliciously tempting clam chowder. It will simple nock our taste buds stocks off. Megan the bar tender and greeter warmly welcomed me. Mentioned all the wonderful unique drinks being offeted.  The cute decor was accented with multiple screens offering the latest sports games.  If your craving high quality sushi that's fairly priced, I would strongly recommend this rock star place.
